729483f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Pelton Avenue
729483f-b.text:
(1)
1262 Richmond Terrace, east side, south of Pelton Avenue, showing a front view of the Pelton House. It was in part erected about 1730, another part was added about 1776, and was the headquarters of General Cortlandt Skinner during the Revolution. It is said that Prince William Henry, afterwards King William IV, was here once. For additional data see "Staten Ialand and its People" by Leng & DDavis, vol. 2, p 936; also "Legends, Stories and Folklore of old S.I." by Hine and Davis,
p 86.
July 7, 1932
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The west end of the house.
July 5, 1932
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A distant view of the Pelton House (center), seen from
near Bement Avenue.
November 4, 1931
P. L. Sperr
729483f-b.folder: Richmond Terrace & Pelton Avenue, Staten Island, NY
